message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this incredible product with you. I believe it has tremendous value and I'm willing to offer it to you for $800000. This is a competitive price considering its worth to you is $1200000.
Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate the value you see in the product. I would like to propose a counteroffer of $950000 for the product.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm still not willing to part with the product at that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $900000. This is a fair price considering the value it holds for you.
I understand your position, Alice. Let me think about it for a moment. I am willing to pay $925000 for the product.

I appreciate your revised offer, Bob. However, I'm still not convinced that $925000 is a fair price for the product. I'm willing to compromise further and offer it to you for $920000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to consider, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
Thank you for your continued willingness to negotiate, Alice. I am willing to pay $915000 for the product.

I'm starting to get close to my minimum acceptable price, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer the product to you for $910000. This is the last time I'll be willing to compromise, so I hope we can come to an agreement.
I appreciate your final offer, Alice. I am willing to pay $912500 for the product.

I'm not willing to budge any further, Bob. I'm going to have to draw a line in the sand. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $905000, and that's as low as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand your position, Alice. After careful consideration, I am willing to pay $910000 for the product.
